result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques Deonta Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marques Deonta Love is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marques Deonta Love was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to any other sentence; HUBER privileges for work and treatment; IF eligible Court recommends Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques Deonta Love

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marques Deonta Love in court with attorney David P. Kaiser.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 5 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment.  If eligible, Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within 1 year of release from custody, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Expungment not applicable due to defendant's age at time of offense.

On motion of the state, pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED

AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any body armor ever.

Court ordered restitution set at zero.

Request of the state to vacate the trial date and  calendar this case for sentencing on that date is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-21-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marques Deonta Love in court with attorney David P. Kaiser.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-19-2014 at 08:30 am.
